headline.main: PHILADELPHIA.; The Weather--The Attorney-General and the Quarantine Affairs-Accidents-Incidents--Markets, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have had another hot and sultry day the thermometer varying from 90[degrees] to 93[degrees], driving a number of our folks down to Cape May. WILLIAM B. REED, our energetic Attorney General, took the initiatory steps this morning to bring our Quarantine officers to their senses.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of this New-York Daily Times: There have been published in the TIMES a Number of interesting, and so far as I have seen, faithful communications, descriptive of the condition of the lower orders of society in this city. This is well.
docs.snippet: To the Editor of this New-York Daily Times: There have been published in the TIMES a Number of interesting, and so far as I have seen, faithful communications, descriptive of the condition of the lower orders of society in this city. This is well.

headline.main: VERMONT.; Divorce Suit at Montpeller--Cruelty of a Husband--Railroad Accidents, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: A good deal of excitement has been recently created in this vicinity by the incidents connected with the action of the Supreme Court on an application for divorce. The petitioner was Mrs. ADELINE LANGDON, wife of JOHN B. LANGDON, whose harsh and cruel treatment of her has been for some time a matter of public notoriety.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. ROBT. J. WALKER'S departure for China seems to be still involved in doubt. We sincerely trust we are not to understand our Washington correspondent as intimating, in his letter published yesterday, the remotest probability that Mr. W. may decline altogether to fulfil the mission he so recently accepted. Still, we fear it may be so.

headline.main: ENGLAND.; Macaulay's Speeches--English Views of American Education--Hackney Coaches--Long Pole Wellesley--Turkish Affairs, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MACAULAY appeals to be in demand in the literary as well as political market. Two publishers, (one of them Messrs. LONGMAN Co.,) announce editions of his speeches, culled specially from HANSARD; and carefully revised, with a view of their circulation in a new shape.

docs.lead_paragraph: Interesting to Owners of Building--Contractors, Laborers, Material--Men, and Others. OPINION?? OF JUDGE THOMPSON, IN RELATION TO THE MECHANICS' LIEN LAW.--MARINE COURT.--Keenan vs Waller and Cunningham--The material facts in this case were, that on the 22d day of March, 1853, the defendant, Cunningham, agreed to erect two buildines for the defendant, Waller, agreeable to certain drawings and specifications, and to complete the same, on or before the twent??eth day of May, succeeding.

docs.lead_paragraph: The young lady who had lost here purse, called at a house near Union-square one day last week. She had just come, as usual, from NEW-Haven, and wished to see Mr.--on some important law business of her mother's. He was not at home, and she then desired to consult Mrs. _____.
